alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 5:18PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact areas near Joseph City and Winslow across portions of Navajo and Coconino Counties through 600 PM MST... At 516 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Joseph City to Winslow. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and patchy blowing dust ahead of rain and storms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Blowing dust may reduce visibility along I-40 between Winslow and Joseph City. Locations impacted include... Winslow, Joseph City and Homolovi State Park Campground. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 252 and 276. Interstate 40 between mile markers 246 and 276. State Route 377 between mile markers 22 and 28. State Route 87 between mile markers 327 and 361. State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Patchy blowing dust ahead of rain and storms may result in reduced visibility...especially along the I-40 corridor between Joseph City and Winslow.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
